links.title: How billionaire tech mogul Elon Musk got his start
links.description: Whether or not you think Elon Musk can recover from the very public SpaceX failure, there's no denying he's a visionary. The CEO of SpaceX and Tesla is working to shuttle humans to Mars, bring electric vehicles to the mass market, and revolutionize both artificial intelligence and transportation - with some hits and misses.

links.title: An Airbag For Tesla Longs
links.description: Click to enlarge Elon Musk Adds To Global Warming As Seeking Alpha contributor Chris DeMuth, Jr. noted, September got off to a rough start for Elon Musk. His SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying an Israeli satellite for Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) exploded on a launch pad on Cape Canaveral, and his Lazard (NYSE: LAZ) announced a $400 million relating to Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) proposed acquisition of SolarCity (NASDAQ: SCTY).

links.title: Trump and Atlantic City: the lessons behind the demise of his casino empire
links.description: The night of 2 April 1990 is one Tina Condos will never forget. It was the opening night of Donald Trump's new $1.1bn Atlantic City casino, and Condos was working as a cocktail waitress serving drinks to Michael Jackson, Elle Macpherson and the other stars and socialites who had flown in for the big night.

links.title: A Pairs Trade For The Tesla - Solar City Tinderbox
links.description: Solar stocks have had a rough 2016. Solar City ( SCTY) seems doomed to join the long line of troubled companies that fell from grace. The stock is down 64% year-to-date and has traded with a downward bias since its all-time high in February, 2014.

links.title: Tesla Motors Inc (TSLA) Head Of Data Science Jumps Ship For Emerging Local Rival
links.description: Published By: Eunice Gettys on August 31, 2016 01:20 pm EST Data science is becoming very popular in several industries, particularly automobile, where companies focus on software as a key element of their car platforms. Tesla Motors Inc ( NASDAQ:TSLA) uses data science extensively via its entire feedback cycle from service to engineering, according to Electrek.
